byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Venissieux, France, and Elian Peltier from Paris.

abstract: Yassine Salhi, identified by French authorities as man who decapitated his boss before setting off explosion at American-owned chemical plant in Lyon, had joined group of radical Islamists and was on national list of potential security threats in 2006; apparent removal of his name from active watch list by 2008 underscores complexity of maintaining vigilance as number of identified potential terrorists continues to grow.
lead_paragraph: Yassine Salhi, who the authorities say decapitated his boss before setting off an explosion at a chemical plant on Friday, belonged to the circle around a radical Islamist.

headline.main: Suspect in Attack in France Had Ties to Radical Islamist
headline.print_headline: Suspect in Attack in France Had Ties to Radical Islamist

snippet: Yassine Salhi, who the authorities say decapitated his boss before setting off an explosion at a chemical plant on Friday, belonged to the circle around a radical Islamist.
